Paragraph.Text: the carcass breast has sufficient fullness of flesh on both sides of the keel bone to prevent an extremely sharp falling away of flesh from the anterior to the posterior end and the keel bone does not project more than 5 mm beyond the flesh; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the carcass has no prominent discolourations exceeding an area of 14.5 cm2 in the aggregate.

Subsection.Text: Mature chicken may not be graded Canada C if the carcass meets the standards for the grade Canada A or the grade Canada Utility.
Every person who requests a certificate of inspection for processed poultry for which a grade prescribed by these Regulations was assigned shall make an application to an inspector for an inspection.

Where an inspector inspects processed poultry and finds that it meets the grade requirements and standards of these Regulations and is packaged, marked and labelled in accordance with these Regulations, the inspector shall issue a certificate of inspection.

Section.Text: As a condition to the application or use of a grade name prescribed by these Regulations, processed poultry shall be packed in accordance with section 62.

Subsection.Text: Every container in which processed poultry is packed shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be strong enough to protect the poultry;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if constructed of corrugated fibreboard, be sound in construction, clean and free from discolouration and objectionable odours; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if constructed of material other than corrugated fibreboard,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be suitable for cleaning and disinfection and free from noxious substances, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: be cleaned and disinfected before being reused.

Subsection.Text: Every poultry carcass in a container shall be individually wrapped to prevent the processed poultry from adhering to the container, except where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the container is lined with wax paper or other material; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the inner walls of the container are treated with wax or other material.

Subsection.Text: Material used in packing or wrapping processed poultry shall not come into contact with the poultry unless the material

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is of a kind that does not impart to processed poultry any obnoxious quality;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is durable and effective having regard to the manner in which it is used; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: will not tear when it is wet.

Subsection.Text: No shrinkable material shall be used to wrap processed poultry for freezing unless the material is fitted to the shape of the poultry to form a package that is undamaged.
No processed poultry shall be packed in a container with other processed poultry unless that other poultry bears the same common name and has a grade name prescribed by these Regulations.

Section.Text: As a condition to the application or use of a grade name prescribed by these Regulations, every container of processed poultry shall, subject to this Part, be marked in accordance with sections 64 to 67, the Food and Drug Regulations, the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations and the Meat Inspection Regulations, 1990.

Subsection.Text: Every container of processed poultry shall be marked with the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the grade name of the poultry;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the words “With Giblets” and “Avec abattis”, if giblets are packed with the poultry;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the establishment number of the establishment at which the processed poultry was prepared, unless the establishment number is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: marked on a label attached to the container or clearly engraved on a metal clip that seals the wrapping containing the poultry, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: marked on every tag attached to the poultry;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a container of processed poultry that is a prepackaged product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the common name of the poultry,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the identity and principal place of business of the person by or for whom the poultry was produced for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: all markings required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the poultry in the form and manner required by subsection 6(2) of the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a container of processed poultry that is not a prepackaged product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the common name of the poultry,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the words “For Further Processing” or “Pour transformation ultérieure”, where the container contains poultry that is not individually marked and is intended for further processing,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the establishment,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the net weight of the poultry, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the words “May Contain Kidneys” or “Peut contenir les reins”, where the kidneys have not been removed, the poultry in the container is not marked with those words and

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the poultry is chicken or Rock Cornish hen and the poultry carcass weighs no more than 2 kg, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the poultry is a duck and the poultry carcass weighs no more than 3 kg.

Subsection.Text: Where processed poultry is prepackaged, it shall be marked with the following information in addition to the information referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the container is a wrapping,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the common name of the ingredients and components of the poultry if the poultry has been basted, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the instructions for storage in the form and manner required under the Food and Drugs Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the words “basted — imprégné”, “pre-basted — pré-imprégné”, “deep basted — imprégné en profondeur” or “self basted — auto-imprégné” and the words “graded before basting — classé avant imprégnation” if the poultry has been basted;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the words “may have parts missing — des parties peuvent manquer”, if the poultry is graded Canada Utility;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the words “breast bone removed — bréchet enlevé”, if the breast bone has been removed;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the words “May Contain Kidneys” and “Peut contenir les reins”, if the kidneys have not been removed and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the poultry is chicken or Rock Cornish hen and the poultry carcass weighs no more than 2 kg, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the poultry is a duck and the poultry carcass weighs no more than 3 kg;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Stuffed” and “Farci” and the words “Graded Before Stuffing” and “Classé avant d’être farci”, if the processed poultry has been stuffed; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Seasoned” and “Assaisonné” and the words “Graded Before Seasoning” and “Classé avant assaisonnement”, if the processed poultry has been seasoned.

Subsection.Text: Subject to this Part, the information required to be shown on a container of processed poultry or on tag attached to processed poultry shall be shown in the official language or languages and in the form and manner that information is required by the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations to be shown.
Subject to subsections (5) and (6), where a poultry carcass is not individually wrapped, the following information shall be shown on a tag attached to the V of the wishbone of the carcass:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the common name of the poultry;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the grade name of the carcass, shown in white letters within the outline of a maple leaf in the same proportion as that illustrated in Schedule I to this Part;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the identity and principal place of business of the person by or for whom the carcass was packaged for resale;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the establishment number; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the words “May Contain Kidneys” and “Peut contenir les reins”, if the kidneys have not been removed and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the poultry is chicken or Rock Cornish hen and the poultry carcass weighs no more than 2 kg, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the poultry is a duck and the poultry carcass weighs no more than 3 kg.

Subsection.Text: The information required by subsection (4) to be shown on a tag shall be shown in a size of type not less than 1.5 mm in height.
Subsection (4) does not apply to a poultry carcass packed in a container marked with the words “For Further Processing” or “Pour transformation ultérieure”.

Where processed poultry is individually wrapped, the identity referred to in paragraph 12(b) of the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations and the grade name of the poultry shall be shown on that part of the wrapping lying immediately on or over the anterior centre of the breast of the poultry.
Where processed poultry is not a prepackaged product, the information required by subsection (1) may be shown on the container or on a label attached to the container.

Where processed poultry is not a prepackaged product and the information required by subsection (1) is shown on a label, the label shall be not less than 7.5 cm by 10 cm in dimension and the information on it shall be shown in a size of type not less than 6 mm in height for the common name and grade name and 3 mm in height for the other information.

Where processed poultry is not a prepackaged product and the information required by subsection (1) is shown on a container, the information shall be shown in a size of type not less than 6 mm in height.

In the case of a prepackaged product graded Canada A or Canada C, the identity referred to in paragraph 12(b) of the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations and the letter A or C in the grade name shall be shown in bold face type and shall be of not less than the following height:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 3 mm where the net weight of the processed poultry is 1 kg or less;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 6 mm where the net weight of the processed poultry is more than 1 kg but not more than 5 kg; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 9 mm where the net weight of the processed poultry is more than 5 kg.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a prepackaged product graded Canada Utility, the word “Utility” in the grade name shall be shown in bold face type in letters of not less than the following height:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 3 mm where the net weight of the processed poultry is 5 kg or less; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 5 mm where the net weight of the processed poultry is more than 5 kg.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (5), where processed poultry is graded Canada A, Canada Utility or Canada C, the grade name shall be shown in white letters within the outline of a maple leaf in the same proportion as that illustrated in Schedule I to this Part and shall be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where the poultry is a prepackaged product, on the container;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the poultry is not a prepackaged product and is in a container, on the container or on a label attached to the container; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where a tag is attached to the poultry, on the tag.

Subsection.Text: Where processed poultry is not a prepackaged product and is in a container, the grade name may be shown in black letters within the outline of the maple leaf.
Subject to subsection (4), the outline of a maple leaf required to be shown on a container, tag or label pursuant to subsection (1) or (2) shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: red, where the poultry is graded Canada A;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: blue, where the poultry is graded Canada Utility; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: brown, where the poultry is graded Canada C.

Subsection.Text: Where the processed poultry is not a prepackaged product and is in a container, the outline of a maple leaf required by subsection (1) to be shown may be the colour for the grade set out in subsection (3) or may be black.
Where a container of processed poultry is a box, case or other enclosure, the grade name required by subsection (1) to be shown is not required to be within the outline of a maple leaf.

Subject to subsection (7), the common name of processed poultry and the words “Product of Canada — Produit du Canada”, if marked, shall be shown in the same colour as the maple leaf for the grade set out in subsection (3) and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where the poultry is a prepackaged product, shall be shown on the container; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the grade name of the poultry is marked on a tag attached to the poultry, shall be shown on the tag.

Subsection.Text: Where processed poultry is not a prepackaged product and is in a container, the common name of the processed poultry and the words “Product of Canada — Produit du Canada” may be shown in black letters on the container or on a label attached to the container.

Section.Text: No label on processed poultry shall be marked with any word or words declaring or implying that the processed poultry is superior in quality to the grade marked on it.

Outline of a maple leaf with the following text inside CANADA C

Section.Text: The following Regulations are repealed:

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the Livestock and Poultry Carcass Grading Regulations20;
